origination.corpname: Washington State University. University Relations. Vice President

did.unittitle: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University University Relations Vice President Files
did.abstract: Annual reviews, project proposals from 1973-1991. Also includes architectual plans primarily related to the redesign of Glenn Terrell Friendship Mall from 1991-1992.

bioghist.p: A legislative enactment of 1890 founded Washington State University, originally called Washington Agricultural College and School of Science. Actual instruction began in January 1892. The enabling act normally is used to date university events, and accordingly the 100th anniversary was observed in 1990.

A system of several committees had responsibility for the University centennial, while the Office of University Relations served as staff and coordinators. The principal coordinators, Dan Peterson and Sonia Hussa, maintained the records of the centennial activities and projects.

scopecontent.p: Primarily architectual plans, proposals, and correspondence relating to the redesign Glenn Terrell Mall circa 1992 . Also includes annual reports, and a chronology of the Kamiak Butte controversy in 1973.

arrangement.p: This is an unprocessed collection. Any arrangement reflects either a pre-existing order from the records' creators or previous custodians, or preliminary sorting performed by staff.
Contains project proposals, correspondence, architectual plans, and budgets related to Glenn Terrell Mall and Kamiak Butte Transmitter relocation. Files are organized in no discernable order.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University University Relations Vice President Files, 1973-1993 (UA2009-03)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: The provenance of this material is unknown. It was received at WSU Libraries' MASC in February, 2009 and retained as UA2009-03.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
